intro: Dipentaplandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Madagascar, and the Arabian Peninsula. The plants are characterized by their attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. They are typically herbaceous perennials, often grown as houseplants due to their compact size and ornamental value. The genus includes several species, with Dipentaplandra sanguinea being one of the most commonly cultivated varieties.
